frame.name: Presence
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Entity</fen> exists at a particular <fen>Location</fen>, at a particular <fen>Time</fen>, as observed by an implicit observer. A <fen>Depictive</fen> and/or <fen>Duration</fen> phrase is often found.
This frame differs from Existence in that the <fen>Location</fen> is profiled as a ground where an observer is conceived of as confirming the <fen>Entity</fen>'s existence.
<ex><fex name="Entity">Liquid water</fex> <m>was</m> <t>present</t> <fex name="Location">on the surface of Mars</fex> <fex name="Time">billions of years ago</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Entity">Urate</fex> <m>was</m> <t>present</t> <fex name="Depictive">in varying concentrations</fex> <fex name="Location">in the bathing solution only</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Entity">No one</fex> <m>was</m> <t>present</t>. <fex name="Location">DNI</fex></ex>
<ex><fex name="Entity">Your</fex> <t>presence</t> is appreciated. <fex name="Location">DNI</fex></ex>
In some cases, the <fen>Location</fen> may be recoverable from phrases that primarily express peripheral information:
<ex><m>Was</m> <fex name="Entity">the senator</fex> <t>present</t> <fex name="Duration">for the committee vote</fex>?</ex> <ex>Was the senator <t>present</t> <fex name="Location">for the committee vote</fex>?</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Entity
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Entity</fen> whose existence at the <fen>Location</fen> is confirmed.</def-root>

FE.name: Location
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Location</fen> of the <fen>Entity</fen>. The <fen>Location</fen> is conceived as a ground for an event of inspection to determine the presense of the <fen>Entity</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The time when the <fen>Entity</fen> is present at the <fen>Location</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>A separate description of the state of the <fen>Entity</fen> when it is present.</def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time period during which the <fen>Entity</fen> is present. In this frame, <fen>Duration</fen> may be expressed with <m>for</m> preceding an event which stands for the duration of the event. In cases where the <fen>Entity</fen> is sentient, there may be an inference that the <fen>Entity</fen>'s intent is to be present so as to participate in the event.
<ex>I can be <t>present</t> <fex name="dur">for the first half of the ceremony and the last part of the reception</fex>, but I'll have to leave in the middle.</ex>
<ex>A catalyst should typically be <t>present</t> <fex name="dur">for the thermal and/or photochemically induced curing of the coating composition applied onto a suitable substrate</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>The purpose of the <fen>Entity</fen>.
<ex>Mr. Jones will be <t>present</t> <fex name="pur">to answer your questions</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: present.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: being or occurring in a particular place.

lexUnit.name: presence.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the state or fact of being present.
